body.name: Cherry Blossom Tree Building Set with LED Light 3 Modes - 3220 Pcs Peach Blossom Micro Mini Building Blocks Set for Kids Adults - Cherry Bonsai Kit Educational Toys for Birthday Gift Valentines
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Thursday, February 22. Order within 20 hrs 38 mins
features: 🌸【Higher Difficulty Building Set】- This Cherry Bonsai Tree building set consists of 3320 micro mini blocks. Micro-sized bricks are smaller than regular-sized bricks, with greater challenges, complexity and details than any other architecture building blocks set. The resulting Cherry Tree House Set fosters a sense of achievement.

🌸【Amazing Design】- This 3D Sakura Tree House building set is uniquely shaped with the island suspended in the air. The floating island contains a palace surrounded by beautiful plants, with luminous waterfalls and boats below. You can place the cherry tree house in your living room,bedroom or office,it will surely make your friends and family marvel.

🌸【High Quality Mini Block】- Cherry Blossom Tree building Set is made of original ABS plastic material and Bright colors bricks; Built-in LED light and has three light modes, giving off a beautiful glow in the dark. The set is neatly packaged in a box with a detailed manual for easy assembly.

🌸【Play While Building】- Enjoy quality time with family or friends through the interactive building process. This activity not only enhances hands-on and independent thinking abilities but also promotes patience and carefulness. The result is a beautifully detailed cherry blossom tree house, combining entertainment with education.

🌸【Ideal Gift Idea】- The big architecture enjoy building block set is the perfect gift for family, friends and children. Suitable for Birthday Parties, valentine's Day, Christmas, Thanksgiving and other.Whether it's for playtime, stress relief, or a shared bonding experience, this building block set guarantees enjoyment and satisfaction for recipients of all ages.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really like this building set
reviews.reviewText: I’ve never done one of these before but I’ve always looked at them and wanted to try one. I’m so glad I got this!! Pieces are very small, so may not be very enticing for some people. Me on the other hand, I love things like this. Clearly I am not done with it yet, but I’ve been working on it! The pieces came kind of sorted in the bags as you can see in the pictures. They didn’t come sorted by color or by step number in the instructions. Instead, they came sorted by the type of piece and color. So all of the clear flat 1x4 blocks were together but mixed with maybe all the blue flat 1x2 blocks and so on. I decided to sort them by color and then stack them by size. I have stored them in a compartment case that way I can close the lid when I am done working on it and not have to worry about losing any pieces since they’re so small. The instructions I feel like are hit or miss. Some steps are very simple to understand while others are confusing and hard to tell in the pictures what pieces go where. But overall, this is very entertaining for me. I don’t get bored doing it and it’s very rewarding to see my progress along the way. I definitely recommend this! And I am definitely looking forward to getting another one!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It's SO fun... then it's not... then it IS again!
reviews.reviewText: I was so excited to put this together. I LOVE "building toys" so this was a great option to a more expensive brand. Lots of pieces and lots of amazing details. SO fun right??Now, maybe I've been spoiled to that more expensive brand because it clearly details what is where and in which bag and has pretty foolproof instructions. THIS... was not that. EVERY bag has pieces from EVERY step in it. So you have no choice, but to open EVERY bag for this whole project. This is where it's no fun. I don't have a lot of space for building so opening like 9 bags of weirdly sorted pieces is ridiculous. You should definitely get some sort of sorting system going or you'll be looking for pieces for a while before you find what you need. And let's address the fact that these are MINI pieces so they're not the normal brick size. That makes sorting and trying to keep these things from going all over the place insanely frustrating. Add to that, they don't EXACTLY fit together perfectly so there was a good amount of shifting I had to do to get some parts to fit together. My giant adult hands kept flinging the smaller pieces across the room because they wouldn't snap together and once I applied some shifting and pressure it was like a catapult! (thankfully, they do give you a few extras of some pieces). It comes with a tool to pry pieces apart in case you make a mistake (which were plentiful), but I ended up using a tweezer a lot since the piece would bend sometimes when trying to get in the crevices. (great addition, but horribly made) I chose this alternative for myself so I can't be mad at some of the drawbacks, but good grief!Oh wait, it's fun again... Once your brain acclimates to the god awful sorting system and you start to figure out where certain pieces might be (Thank god the same pieces are sorted together) the build goes a little quicker. After seeing it start to come together, it gets fun again. It comes with a light kit for the water so I'm super excited to see that when it's all done. I still have a ways to go and I'm not sure how long this is going to take me as I only have a couple of hours each week to work on it, but it's going to be a beautiful build once complete. I would definitely recommend this set, but manage your expectations and be prepared with a plan of action... lol

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The instructions are very confusing for the water fall and it’s very difficult to build

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful building set for adults or older teens
reviews.reviewText: This building set is so beautiful! There are a lot of pieces and it is very intricate, so I would not purchase for a child. Luckily though, I am an adult who loves to build with Lego. This is a much more reasonably priced set, perfect for me!One of the biggest reasons I say this is for adults is because these pieces are so much smaller than Lego pieces. A 2x2 brick of these pieces is probably equivalent to the size of a 1 dot Lego piece. In fact, I highly recommend using a pair of tweezers to make it easier to handle and manipulate these pieces.I love that it comes with a light brick! That little extra elevates the set even more.My son and I are currently building this. It is not a quick one day project! It is providing an invaluable bonding experience for us though!I love doing something electronic free, especially in the evening. I can't wait until we complete this set. It's so beautiful that I am going to display on a shelf once it is complete.I highly recommend this building set! It is an incredible value and a lot of fun to build. Make sure you are buying for an adult or older teen though. The pieces are too small for kids to manipulate.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Fair Micro mini Blocks interpretation of Cherry Blossom Tree w/LED lighting
reviews.reviewText: This is a more than 3200 piece micro mini blocks kit of a Cherry Blossom tree and building. Unfortunately, there is no numbering on the bags or in the full color instruction book. That means you have to open up all the bags in order to find the necessary pieces for each step (a daunting task with so many pieces) . The LED lighting is barely addressed in the assembly manual and leaves something to be desired.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Challenging but beautiful
reviews.reviewText: This took my son days to complete due to the pieces being so small. I had to help thread the lights into the waterfalls and it wasn’t easy to get them to stay but it is so pretty with the lights turned on. The large cherry blossom tree on top had a few pieces missing; not sure if we lost them when emptying out the bags or what. But that was so hard to put together that we gave up and put it in a bag to do later. This is definitely for someone with patience and it’s rated for teens and up because of how small the pieces are. But I would definitely recommend. It’s a beautiful piece to keep out as decor.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Tiny bricks, but fun to build
reviews.reviewText: These bricks are as micro as it gets (included picture shows some next to a lego brick), and there are no numbered bags. It took me hours just to pre-sort the thousands of pieces in a way that it became possible to start, and I still have trouble finding pieces sometimes. However they do stick well together (good clutch) and the directions are good though you're going to need to use some creativity with the lighting. I haven't finished it yet but it's enjoyable as long as you know what you're in for, and I am loving how the details are coming together.
